> Can you delete a thread you started?

Only as long as no one else has posted in it. After that, it wouldn't be fair to others to delete their posts. As OP, though, you can ask for your own thread to be closed.

How much rep do I need to get a second bar? I have 28, and one 'bar'. By bar I mean the green rectangles right above your avatar

> 
> How much rep do I need to get a second bar? I have 28, and one 'bar'. By bar I mean the green rectangles right above your avatar

Every 100 rep you get a bar.(not a mod, just know this)

> 
> Every 100 rep you get a bar.(not a mod, just know this)

Every 100 until 500 (at which point you'll have five green and one light green bars), then it's one light green bar every 200 points. (Full 5 green/6 light green at 1,500 points)

> Does anyone experience a forum bug where, sometimes if you start typing a word that you forgot in a sentence, it doesn't push the text forward, but instead removes it, one letter at a time?

The "insert" key will toggle between additive text and replacing text in most text editors.

It definitely is not a forum bug, this is a common feature.

How much effort does it take to change a username, e.g in the name change thread and why can users only have one name change?

> 
> How much effort does it take to change a username, e.g in the name change thread and why can users only have one name change?

Not a mod (yet) but I can answer these, as I'm the one who started the name change thread. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

It's not THAT hard to change it, they just have to get verification from you and remind you to log in with the new name next time you log in. 

We are limited to one name change so people don't constantly change names. You wouldn't be able to recognize anyone. If I was bob tomorrow, and then KSPFreak the next, and then THISISSPARTA the next day, you would have no idea who I am. We're limited to keep our sense of identity with our usernames. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Thank you! (and Alphasus) Now I want them more!

> 
> How much effort does it take to change a username, e.g in the name change thread and why can users only have one name change?

Endersmens is correct.

> 
> Thank you! (and Alphasus) Now I want them more!

It will come in time. Contribute to the community or build some neat stuff to share. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Cheers,

~Claw

> 
> How much effort does it take to change a username?

I have to open up the special admin controls, search the user database for names matching what you want to change your name to, verify that it isn't already taken, then search your current name, go into your profile, verify it's the same person, edit your name to the one you want to change to, hit save, then go out of the admin box, reply in the thread that it has been changed, then go to your forum profile and add a user note stating that you changed your name and what your name originally was.
